title: Verify that the Search with a combination of package,patron,agency,user,date range is working fine.
custom_steps:
1. Launch PV application.
Expected Result:
Logged into PV application successfully.
2. Navigate to Ticketing - Ticket Services.
Expected Result:
Ticket Services page loaded properly.
3. Click on Advanced Search.
Expected Result:
Advanced Search screen loaded successfully with all UI contents properly.
4. Enter Package field detail along with Patron/User
Expected Result:
Patron/User details should be entered 
successfully.
5. Select a date range.
Expected Result:
Date range should be selected successfully.
6. Click on Find.
Expected Result:
Results should be displayed based on the 
search criteria.
7. Verify the displayed results.
Expected Result:
Make sure that the package details should be 
displayed based on the search criteria.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch PV application.
2. Navigate to Ticketing - Ticket Services.

6. Click on Find.
7. Verify the displayed results.

successfully.

title: Once seats are added verify that the user is able to do different actions on an order in Ticket Services
custom_steps:
1. 1. Set the following permissions in AFP
a)Add Seats to Existing Orders- true
b)Ignore Add Seats to Order Restriction Date- false
Set value for ADD seats to Order Restriction Date (Supplier Admin)
2. Perform  ticket sale/reservation with a patron and  select a unfulfilled delivery
Expected Result:
The pre-requisite should be met.
2. Login to PV application
Username: bouser1
Password: Boxuser01
Expected Result:
Login should be successful
3. Go to Ticket Services Portal and Enter the search criteria and click on Find button.
Expected Result:
User should be able toenter the search criteria and results should be displayed.
4. Click on the Order Id disaplyed
Expected Result:
The Order deatils should displayed in the order view.
5. Verify in the order detail block of the order view, a new action should be presented called "Add Seats to Order".
Expected Result:
A new action should be presented called "Add Seats to Order" in the order detail block of the order view
6. Select "Add Seats to Order" action in the ticket services.
Expected Result:
User should be able to select "Add Seats to Order" icon and navigated to ticket sales portal.
7. Select the no of seats and lock it.
Expected Result:
User should be able to select seats and added to an existing order.
8. Navigate to Ticket Services and search for the same order already added in the cart.
Expected Result:
User should be able to search the ame order that is already added in the cart.
9. Verify that the user is able to do different actions 
on an order in Ticket Services

Verify the user is able to change the delivery
Expected Result:
User should be able to different actions.
User should be able toAdd Seats to Order
User should be able to select different actions 
from the drop down 'Retrun/ Exchange' and click 
on Apply changes.

User should be able to change the delivery
10. 1. Select "Logout" from the drop down
Expected Result:
The user should be successfully logged off

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1. Set the following permissions in AFP
a)Add Seats to Existing Orders- true
b)Ignore Add Seats to Order Restriction Date- false
Set value for ADD seats to Order Restriction Date (Supplier Admin)
2. Perform  ticket sale/reservation with a patron and  select a unfulfilled delivery
2. Login to PV application
Username: bouser1
Password: Boxuser01
3. Go to Ticket Services Portal and Enter the search criteria and click on Find button.
4. Click on the Order Id disaplyed
5. Verify in the order detail block of the order view, a new action should be presented called "Add Seats to Order".
6. Select "Add Seats to Order" action in the ticket services.
7. Select the no of seats and lock it.
8. Navigate to Ticket Services and search for the same order already added in the cart.
9. Verify that the user is able to do different actions 
on an order in Ticket Services

Verify the user is able to change the delivery
10. 1. Select "Logout" from the drop down
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. The pre-requisite should be met.
2. Login should be successful
3. User should be able toenter the search criteria and results should be displayed.
4. The Order deatils should displayed in the order view.
5. A new action should be presented called "Add Seats to Order" in the order detail block of the order view
6. User should be able to select "Add Seats to Order" icon and navigated to ticket sales portal.
7. User should be able to select seats and added to an existing order.
8. User should be able to search the ame order that is already added in the cart.
9. User should be able to different actions.
User should be able toAdd Seats to Order
User should be able to select different actions 
from the drop down 'Retrun/ Exchange' and click 
on Apply changes.

User should be able to change the delivery
10. The user should be successfully logged off

title: Verify if the  default delivery method is automatically assigned when the order is in context

2.Set the following permissions in AFP
a)Add Seats to Existing Orders- true
b)Ignore Add Seats to Order Restriction Date- false
3.Perform a ticket sale using event EVT1and patron PAT1 and select a unfulfilled delivery and note the order id.
4.Navigate to Ticket Services and note the delivery method assigned.
Expected Result:
The pre-requisite should be met.
2. Login to PV application
Username: bouser1
Password: Boxuser01
Expected Result:
Login should be successful
3. Navigate to Ticketing tab and select Ticket Sales from Drop down
Search for the Patron PAT1
Expected Result:
The Patron  details should be displayed in ticket sales portal
4. Click on ORDERS button available
Select the order created in pre-requisites
Expected Result:
The Order should be selected in context
5. Search for an event and select the number of seats required
Click on Lock Seats button
Expected Result:
The seats should be locked and added to the Existing order
6. Verify the delivery method noted in pre-requisites is automatically assigned
Expected Result:
The Delivery method  should be assigned automatically.
7. 1.Choose a  payment method and make the payment
2. Click on "Checkout" button
Expected Result:
The transaction should be completed successfully
8. Click on "Logout" link
Expected Result:
The user should be successfully logged off
9. Verify in Ticket Services for the new seats to be added in the order noted in pre-requisites
Expected Result:
New seats should be added to the order noted in pre-requisites

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1.Create a new event EVT1 and a new patron PAT1

a)Add Seats to Existing Orders- true
b)Ignore Add Seats to Order Restriction Date- false

Password: Boxuser01

2. Click on "Checkout" button

Save the changes

Click on Validate Button

8. Verify assigning registered patrons while seat upgrade_upgrading to lesser ticket quantity

Upgrading should be successful and the assigned patrons should be shown for all the upgraded tickets
E.g. If three tickets are returned and three tickets are bought as part of upgrade, the application should copy the registered patrons of three returned tickets to three tickets of upgrade.

The remaining registered patrons are assigned in the order of their registered patron id

3. Few Open Item Receivables RT1, RT2, RT3 should be available

2. Click on Find button.
3. Select the 'Open Item Receivable Type' RT1 created in Prerequisites.
Expected Result:
The 'Open Item Receivable Type' RT1 created in Prerequisites should be selected.
7. 1. Select the Channel, Agency and User (let the user be U1) for which the Permission is needed.
2. Select the 'Create' checkbox.
3. Click on the 'Apply Changes' button.
Expected Result:
The Create permission should be assigned to the Receivable Rt1 for the user U1
8. Repeat steps 4 to 6 to assign CREATE permission to the other Receivable Types RT2 and RT3

Expected Result:
seats should be locked

Expected Result:
Complete the transaction
17. Verify the Receivables tab of the corresponding order in Ticket Services

title: Verify whether patron orders are displayed as selectable link when the logged in user has only BOClerk role and Patron Orders role
custom_steps:

2. Launch PV Application using suitable credentials
Expected Result:
Login should be successfull
3. 1.Navigate to User Management portal
2.Create a new user
3.Assign any agency to this user (The agency should have Read acess to the access code of the patron and the events/packages mentioned above)
Expected Result:
New user should be created successfully and the agency should be assigned to the user.

The password for the user should be noted down
4. 1.Navigate to the Role Assignment tab for this user
2.Assign the roles BOClerk and patron Orders to the user
3.Do not assign any other roles to this user

The roles BOClerk and Patron Orders should be added to the user successfully

2.Login as the user mentioned above using the password noted in step 3
Expected Result:

Expected Result:

Expected Result:
User should be navigated to the Order tab

6.Keep the Patron Orders role still available

BOMgmt role should be added to this user instead of BOClerk rol
10. 1.Logout from the Application
2.Login as the user mentioned above again

title: Verify the Make Payment action of the Patron Account Balance tab when the User has Cash Receipt permission
custom_steps:
1. 1. Launch PV application.
2. Login using valid username and password.
Expected Result:
The login should be successful and the Home page of the application should be displayed.
2. 1. Perform a few Open Item Receivable transactions for a Patron.
2. A User should have Read access to the Patron.
3. The User should have Cash receipt permission for an Open Item Receivable type.

4. 1. Input the Patron of Prerequisites in the 'Selected Patron' textbox.
2. Click on the 'Account Balance' tab.
Expected Result:
The Account Balance tab should be selected and displayed.
5. Verify whether the 'Make Payment' button is visible and invokable.
Expected Result:
The 'Make Payment' button should be visible and invokable.
6. 1. Click on the 'Make Payment' button.
2. Make payment in Cart.
3. Complete the transaction.
Expected Result:
The Cash Receipt should be successfully created.

custom_steps:

title: Verify the User is getting validated while  Disbursing multiple account credits at the same time -from same Organization
custom_preconds:
1. A Patron Should available, P1
2. Events 1 and Events 2 are available under supplier A(Arts) and Supplier B(xxxx) respectively  for sale transaction
3. Two suppliers, Supplier A and Supplier B  are available for the same organization Org1 (SPORTS)
4.Set the Sales AFP->Create Account Credit From Return to True
custom_steps:
1. Launch PV application
Expected Result:
PV application should be launched successfully
2. Login as BO user
Expected Result:
Login should be successful
3. Select Ticket Sales under Ticketing menu
Expected Result:
Ticket sales Portal should be displayed
4. 1.Select the ARTS Event to Sell
2. Select patron P1
3. Complete the sale Transaction
Expected Result:
Event should be selected and sale should be completed successfully
5. 1. Navigate to Ticket Services
2. Select the Order Created
3. select RETURN
4, Select few seats

Expected Result:
Order should be placed to cart
6.  Click on Create Credit button 

Return amount should carry forward to create a Credit Creation
Create Credit as In Lieu REFUND.
Expected Result:
Successfully completed the Return Transaction and Created Credit.
7. Create a Sale transaction by using patron P1  for the event Event 2 and make an account credit through Return Transaction type as IN lieu Refund.
Expected Result:
Successfully completed the Return Transaction and Created Credit.
8. 1. Navigate to Patron Management Portal
2. Select and Search patron
3. Navigate to Account balance
4. Verify 2 Account credits are available
5.Select both transactions
6.Click on Disburse button
7.Verify whether user getting validated when selecting multiple supplier for Disbursement
Expected Result:
Validation should be displayed as follows

* You have selected account credits for more than one supplier, disbursement in a single transaction must be for the same supplier. Please revise your selection and try again.
9. Click on the Logout link
Expected Result:
User should be logged out successfully

title: Verify whether error message is displayed when ticket limit is met
custom_preconds:
1.Create Source package SP1 with Packagelist SPL1 with event SE1,SE2
2.Set Exchange limit for SPL1
       Do not set Partial Package Exchange Offer Limit
      Set Partial Package Exchange Ticket Percentage Limit to 50%

3.Perform the package transaction with 2 tickets each 
[i.e.:-Patron has 2 package seats for a full season package of 2 events
o This equals 4 tickets
i.e.:-50% of 4 tickets is 2 tickets ]
 ( Patron can exchange return 2 of their tickets for other events)
custom_steps:
1. Check the default value "mpv.event.exchange.features.enabled" is "True"

Expected Result:
Package list admin and overrides in package list access admin are  hidden

2. 1. Navigate to ticket services
2.select ticket which meets the limit set  for partial exchange (Select 2 tickets)

Expected Result:
 The exchange is succesful
3. Validate the same rules are enforce for below cases:

Seat upgrades
Ticket window return- exchange and upgrade
Expected Result:
Error :
"message": "You have selected more tickets than allowed to exchange. You may exchange up to '2' tickets. Please modify your selections and try again."   
4. verify the same case through map sale
Expected Result:
The same result will be displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Check the default value "mpv.event.exchange.features.enabled" is "True"

2. 1. Navigate to ticket services
2.select ticket which meets the limit set  for partial exchange (Select 2 tickets)

3. Validate the same rules are enforce for below cases:

Seat upgrades
Ticket window return- exchange and upgrade
4. verify the same case through map sale
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Package list admin and overrides in package list access admin are  hidden

2.  The exchange is succesful
3. Error :
"message": "You have selected more tickets than allowed to exchange. You may exchange up to '2' tickets. Please modify your selections and try again."   
4. The same result will be displayed

title: Verify the validation message displayed when one limit is violated before the another
custom_preconds:
1.Create Source package SP1 with Packagelist SPL1 with event SE1,SE2
2.Set Exchange limit for SPL1
 Set Partial Package Exchange Offer Limit to 2
Set Partial Package Exchange Ticket Percentage Limit to 25%
3.Perform 3 package transaction with 2 tickets each 
[i.e.:-Patron has 2 package seats for a full season package of 2 events
o This equals 12 tickets
i.e.:-25% of 12 tickets is 3 tickets ]
 ( Patron can exchange return 3 of their tickets for other events)
custom_steps:
1. Check the default value "mpv.event.exchange.features.enabled" is "True"

Expected Result:
Package list admin and overrides in package list access admin are  hidden

2. 1.Navigate to ticket services.
2.Select order1 with  two tickets and complete the partial exchanger action successfully for two tickets
2.Navigate to ticket services. Select order2 with two tickets for partial exchange and select 2 tickets and apply action

Note:-Refer the example mention in design doc section 5.2.2
Expected Result:
Error message will be displayed since offer limit is violated 
 "message": "You have reached the limit of exchange privileges for this package. If you feel you have received this message in error, please contact customer service."  
3. Validate the same rules are enforce for below cases:

Seat upgrades
Ticket window return- exchange and upgrade
Expected Result:
Error message will be displayed since offer limit is violated 
 "message": "You have reached the limit of exchange privileges for this package. If you feel you have received this message in error, please contact customer service."

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Check the default value "mpv.event.exchange.features.enabled" is "True"

2. 1.Navigate to ticket services.
2.Select order1 with  two tickets and complete the partial exchanger action successfully for two tickets
2.Navigate to ticket services. Select order2 with two tickets for partial exchange and select 2 tickets and apply action

Note:-Refer the example mention in design doc section 5.2.2
3. Validate the same rules are enforce for below cases:

Seat upgrades
Ticket window return- exchange and upgrade

1. Package list admin and overrides in package list access admin are  hidden

2. Error message will be displayed since offer limit is violated

title: Verify whether In Ticket Services, the action to reschedule receivables will only offer an intersection of payment plans
custom_steps:
1. Launch the application
Expected Result:
PV application should be launched successfully.
2. Login as any Box Office user.
Expected Result:
User should be logged in to the PV application.
3. 1. Select Supplier Administration from the menu.
2. Select Payment Plans tab under Supplier Administration.
3. Create a New Payment plan for all events and packages.
4. Make it Active.
Expected Result:
1. Supplier Administration portal should be loaded successfully.
2. Payment Plans portal under Supplier Administration should be loaded.
3. New Payment plan is created and is active.
4. 1. Navigate to Ticket Sales.
2. Select an Event, a Patron and the seats.
3. Navigate to cart.
Expected Result:
The user is navigated to cart.
5. 1. Select the Receivables Tab.
2. Navigate to the second tab Create and Select Payment Plan tab.
3. Verify whether the New Payment plan created is available for that Event.
4. Add one or more events to the order.
Expected Result:
The Payment plan which intersect with all the Events in the order is available.
6. Select that payment plan and complete the transaction.
Expected Result:
Transaction is done successfully and Confirmation # is generated.
7. Navigate to  Ticket Services portal.
Expected Result:
Ticket Services portal is loaded.
8. Verify whether In Ticket Services, the action to reschedule receivables will only offer an intersection of payment plans that are available for all events and packages in the order and fall in the available date ranges.
Expected Result:
The action to reschedule receivables will only offer an intersection of payment plans that are available for all events and packages in the order and fall in the available date ranges.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch the application
2. Login as any Box Office user.
3. 1. Select Supplier Administration from the menu.
2. Select Payment Plans tab under Supplier Administration.
3. Create a New Payment plan for all events and packages.
4. Make it Active.
4. 1. Navigate to Ticket Sales.
2. Select an Event, a Patron and the seats.
3. Navigate to cart.
5. 1. Select the Receivables Tab.
2. Navigate to the second tab Create and Select Payment Plan tab.
3. Verify whether the New Payment plan created is available for that Event.
4. Add one or more events to the order.
6. Select that payment plan and complete the transaction.
7. Navigate to  Ticket Services portal.
8. Verify whether In Ticket Services, the action to reschedule receivables will only offer an intersection of payment plans that are available for all events and packages in the order and fall in the available date ranges.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. PV application should be launched successfully.
2. User should be logged in to the PV application.
3. 1. Supplier Administration portal should be loaded successfully.
2. Payment Plans portal under Supplier Administration should be loaded.
3. New Payment plan is created and is active.
4. The user is navigated to cart.
5. The Payment plan which intersect with all the Events in the order is available.
6. Transaction is done successfully and Confirmation # is generated.
7. Ticket Services portal is loaded.
8. The action to reschedule receivables will only offer an intersection of payment plans that are available for all events and packages in the order and fall in the available date ranges.

title: Verify that Print-Restricted/Printed Icon is displayed in Ticket services for the tickets which are Print Restricted and Printed of a Group sale order
custom_preconds:
Launch PV and login with valid credentials 
Enable the application property for enabling print restricted tickets 
Set AFP permission 'Can print Restricted Tickets' as true and 'Override Print-Restricted Protection ' as false
custom_steps:
1. Login to PV
Expected Result:
Login should be successful
2. Navigate to supplier admin > select supplier

Expected Result:
The user should be navigated and supplier detail page should be displayed
3. Click on configuration and select ESD definition group


Expected Result:
The user should be navigated
4. Click on NEW


Expected Result:
An ESD group page should be displayed
5. Verify whether a new definition type is available in drop down

Expected Result:
The Print restricted definition type will be available
6. Navigate to ESD group (Suppliers XXXX > Baseball > Supplier Extended Seat Groups) and verify whether the definition type Print restricted is available


Expected Result:
The definition type should be available
7. Create an ESG with print restriction definition type


Expected Result:
The ESG should be created successfully
8. 	
Create an ESD with the ESG created above 'Requires Acknowledgement' as True and set 'display message - These are print restricted seats'

Expected Result:
The ESD creation will be successful
9. Associate the ESD to the venue (Set the master configuration as maintenance)


Expected Result:
The ESD should be set in the venue
10. Create an event in the above mentioned venue

Expected Result:
The event should be created successfully
11. Navigate to Ticket Sales
Select the event
Select sale type as GROUP
Lock some ticket and navigate to cart  
Expected Result:
Seats should be locked
12. Complete the sale transaction
Expected Result:
The sale transaction should be completed 
13. Navigate to ticket services->Delivery details page
Select action as Print Selected Tickets
Select the tickets and Print


Expected Result:
Print should be successful
14. Navigate to ticket services->Order details page
Verify that Print-Restricted / Printed icon is displayed for the tickets in the Order details page 
Expected Result:
1.Red Printer icon with !Symbol icon should be displayed

2.Hover text should be displayed as 'The ticket is Print-Restricted and has been printed'

3.This icon shall have the following tooltip text defined: Print-Restricted / Printed.
15. Navigate delivery view
Verify that Print-Restricted / Printed icon is displayed for the tickets in the delivery details page 
Expected Result:
1.Red Printer icon with !Symbol icon should be displayed

2.Hover text should be displayed as 'The ticket is Print-Restricted and has been printed'

3.This icon shall have the following tooltip text defined: Print-Restricted / Printed.
16. Navigate Transaction view
Verify that Print-Restricted / Printed icon is displayed for the tickets in the Transaction details page  
Expected Result:
1.Red Printer icon with !Symbol icon should be displayed

2.Hover text should be displayed as 'The ticket is Print-Restricted and has been printed'

3.This icon shall have the following tooltip text defined: Print-Restricted / Printed.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Login to PV
2. Navigate to supplier admin > select supplier

3. Click on configuration and select ESD definition group


4. Click on NEW


5. Verify whether a new definition type is available in drop down

6. Navigate to ESD group (Suppliers XXXX > Baseball > Supplier Extended Seat Groups) and verify whether the definition type Print restricted is available


7. Create an ESG with print restriction definition type


8. 	
Create an ESD with the ESG created above 'Requires Acknowledgement' as True and set 'display message - These are print restricted seats'

9. Associate the ESD to the venue (Set the master configuration as maintenance)


10. Create an event in the above mentioned venue

11. Navigate to Ticket Sales
Select the event
Select sale type as GROUP
Lock some ticket and navigate to cart  
12. Complete the sale transaction
13. Navigate to ticket services->Delivery details page
Select action as Print Selected Tickets
Select the tickets and Print


14. Navigate to ticket services->Order details page
Verify that Print-Restricted / Printed icon is displayed for the tickets in the Order details page 
15. Navigate delivery view
Verify that Print-Restricted / Printed icon is displayed for the tickets in the delivery details page 
16. Navigate Transaction view
Verify that Print-Restricted / Printed icon is displayed for the tickets in the Transaction details page

7. The ESG should be created successfully
8. The ESD creation will be successful
9. The ESD should be set in the venue
10. The event should be created successfully
11. Seats should be locked
12. The sale transaction should be completed 
13. Print should be successful
14. 1.Red Printer icon with !Symbol icon should be displayed

2.Hover text should be displayed as 'The ticket is Print-Restricted and has been printed'

3.This icon shall have the following tooltip text defined: Print-Restricted / Printed.
15. 1.Red Printer icon with !Symbol icon should be displayed

2.Hover text should be displayed as 'The ticket is Print-Restricted and has been printed'

3.This icon shall have the following tooltip text defined: Print-Restricted / Printed.
16. 1.Red Printer icon with !Symbol icon should be displayed

2.Hover text should be displayed as 'The ticket is Print-Restricted and has been printed'

3.This icon shall have the following tooltip text defined: Print-Restricted / Printed.

title: Perform a group  sale transaction with delivery service charge which Includes Ticket inclusive service charge with Calculation Rule set as Percentage with 5 decimal places
custom_steps:
1. 1. Login to PVNG appliaction
2. Create a Ticket inclusive service charge with calculation rule ser to Percentage/Range
Expected Result:
The service charges should be created
2. Launch and Login to the application
Expected Result:
The user should be able to login to teh application successfully
3. Select Service Charges from the drop down
Expected Result:
Service charge home page should be displayed
4. Select the inclusive service charge created in the pre-requisite
Expected Result:
The service charge detail page should be displayed
5. Input Percentage to 20%
Expected Result:
The service charge changes should be updated successfully
6. Set the delivery charges for a particulat delivery method
Expected Result:
The service charges should be updated successfully.
7. Select Ticket Sales from the drop down list
Expected Result:
The Ticket Sales page should be displayed
8. 1. Input * in the Search Field
2. Click Find Button
3. Click on the Sell icon in the Search Results Grid
4. Select Group Radio button in ticket sales page
Expected Result:
The Selected Event should be listed in the My Events list and should be available for the Sale
9. 1. Input * in the Patron portlet
2. Click Find button
3. Select a patron from the list by clicking the (+) button
Expected Result:
Patron should be listed in the Parton Portlet
10. 1. Input the number of seats
2. Click on Best available
Expected Result:
The patron cart should be displayed
11. 1. Select a Delivery Method from the delivery method portlet
2. Add the address from the file
3. Click on Apply button
Expected Result:
System should allow the user to select an delivery method from the drop down and the delivery method should be added
12. Verify the service charge added to the offer
Expected Result:
1.If  percentage of service charge calculated is less than the Min cap then the Min cap set in step 5 will be added.
2.If percentage of service charge calculated is more than the Max cap then the Max cap set in step 5 will be added.
3.If percentage of service charge calculated is less than the Max cap and more than the Min cape then the Total ticket non-inclusice service charge will be added.
13. 1. Select a payment Method from the Payment Method portlet
2. Input the required details
3. Click on Accept Payment button
Expected Result:
The payment method should be added successfully
14. Click on the Checkout button
Expected Result:
The confirmation number should be displayed as successful completion of the transaction
15. 1. Go to Ticket Services
2. Select Service Charges tab
3. Verify whether the details are displayed correctly.
Expected Result:
The details and the service charge should be calculated and displayed correctly

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1. Login to PVNG appliaction
2. Create a Ticket inclusive service charge with calculation rule ser to Percentage/Range
2. Launch and Login to the application
3. Select Service Charges from the drop down
4. Select the inclusive service charge created in the pre-requisite
5. Input Percentage to 20%
6. Set the delivery charges for a particulat delivery method
7. Select Ticket Sales from the drop down list
8. 1. Input * in the Search Field
2. Click Find Button
3. Click on the Sell icon in the Search Results Grid
4. Select Group Radio button in ticket sales page
9. 1. Input * in the Patron portlet
2. Click Find button
3. Select a patron from the list by clicking the (+) button
10. 1. Input the number of seats
2. Click on Best available
11. 1. Select a Delivery Method from the delivery method portlet
2. Add the address from the file
3. Click on Apply button
12. Verify the service charge added to the offer
13. 1. Select a payment Method from the Payment Method portlet
2. Input the required details
3. Click on Accept Payment button
14. Click on the Checkout button
15. 1. Go to Ticket Services
2. Select Service Charges tab
3. Verify whether the details are displayed correctly.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. The service charges should be created
2. The user should be able to login to teh application successfully
3. Service charge home page should be displayed
4. The service charge detail page should be displayed
5. The service charge changes should be updated successfully
6. The service charges should be updated successfully.
7. The Ticket Sales page should be displayed
8. The Selected Event should be listed in the My Events list and should be available for the Sale
9. Patron should be listed in the Parton Portlet
10. The patron cart should be displayed
11. System should allow the user to select an delivery method from the drop down and the delivery method should be added
12. 1.If  percentage of service charge calculated is less than the Min cap then the Min cap set in step 5 will be added.
2.If percentage of service charge calculated is more than the Max cap then the Max cap set in step 5 will be added.
3.If percentage of service charge calculated is less than the Max cap and more than the Min cape then the Total ticket non-inclusice service charge will be added.
13. The payment method should be added successfully
14. The confirmation number should be displayed as successful completion of the transaction
15. The details and the service charge should be calculated and displayed correctly

title: Verify that Financial patron of the tickets cannot perform recall action on the tickets forwarded during initial sale
custom_steps:
1. Prerequisite:
1.Create an Event
2.Create a patron A
3.Create a patron B
4.Create patron P
Expected Result:
The Pre-Requisite should be met.
2. Launch the PVNG site using 
URL: http://irqaapppvn8.back.tickets.com:18080/portal
Expected Result:
The User should be able to launch into the PV site successfully
3. Login to the PVNG Application using the following credentials


Expected Result:
User should be logged in successfully and should be navigated to the Home page
4. Complete a sale transaction with patron A as the Financial patron & the attending patron B of the delivery with Delivery 1-Transaction1 (a transaction with different Financial patron & Attending Patron).
Expected Result:
Transaction 1 should be completed successfully with Delivery method as  Delivery 1
5. Click on the Confirmation ID
Expected Result:
User should be navigated to the Ticket Services Page showing the Transaction Details
6. Navigate to the Ticket Services from the Ticketing dropdown
Expected Result:
User should be navigated to the Ticket Services Page
7. Perform a search using the Transaction id of Transaction1 and select the Transaction radio button.
Expected Result:
User should be able to Perform a search using the Transaction id of transaction1
8. Navigate to Delivery view by selecting the Deliveries tab
Expected Result:
User should be Navigated to Delivery view
9. 1)Now Navigate to the Ticket Services-->Delivery View of the transaction1
2)Select the radio button "Inactive Tickets Only" and select the action Recall
3)Select all tickets and click on Apply Action
Expected Result:
Recall Action should not be performed
10. Verify that Financial patron of the tickets cannot perform recall action on the tickets forwarded during initial sale
Expected Result:
The Financial patron of the tickets should not be able to perform recall action on the tickets forwarded during initial sale because the delivery is not associated with the patron.
Since the financial patron never had the tickets delivered to themselves, the PV user will only be able to initiate a return-to-sender (i.e. no delivery exists from which to initiate a recall from).
11. Click on logout link
Expected Result:
Logout should be successfull

title: Verify whether a new delivery shall be created when unforwarded tickets of the previous delivery are fullfilled(printed) when a Recall action is performed
custom_preconds: Go to Application Feature Permissions/Ticket Permissions as the current user. Note down the 'Recall/Return-to-Sender Default Delivery Method'
custom_steps:
1. Login to the application.
Expected Result:
The application should be loged in.
2. Complete a sale transaction for 5 tickets with patron A as the Financial patron & the attending patron of the delivery with Delivery method as DHL-Transaction 1 & Delivery 1.
Expected Result:
Transaction should be completed for the Ptron A with DHL delivery method.
3. Navigate to the Ticket services-->Delivery view and select the action Ticket Forward and select 3 tickets and apply the action
Expected Result:
3 tickets should be selected from ticket services, delivery view and forwarded.
4. In the Ticket forward cart, forward the 3 tickets to the attending patron B and complete the transaction- transaction2 & delivery 2.
Verify the order view of the transaction
Expected Result:
3 tickets should be forwarded to Patron B and the transaction should be completed.Order details should be shown correctly as required and the order should be verified.
5. Navigate to the Ticket services-->Delivery view of the transaction1, delivery1 and print the 2 unforwarded tickets.
Expected Result:
2 unforwarded tickets should be printed.
6. Now navigate to the Ticket services-->Delivery view of the transaction1, delivery1 and select the action Recall.
Expected Result:
The tickets from transaction 1 and delivery one should be recalled.
7. Verify if new delivery is created using the Recall/Return-to-Sender Default Delivery Method defined in Application Feature Permissions/Ticket Permissions
Expected Result:
A new delivery should be created using the Recall/Return-to-Sender Default Delivery Method defined in Application Feature Permissions/Ticket Permissions for the 3 tickets on which recall action was performed.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Login to the application.
2. Complete a sale transaction for 5 tickets with patron A as the Financial patron & the attending patron of the delivery with Delivery method as DHL-Transaction 1 & Delivery 1.
3. Navigate to the Ticket services-->Delivery view and select the action Ticket Forward and select 3 tickets and apply the action
4. In the Ticket forward cart, forward the 3 tickets to the attending patron B and complete the transaction- transaction2 & delivery 2.
Verify the order view of the transaction
5. Navigate to the Ticket services-->Delivery view of the transaction1, delivery1 and print the 2 unforwarded tickets.
6. Now navigate to the Ticket services-->Delivery view of the transaction1, delivery1 and select the action Recall.
7. Verify if new delivery is created using the Recall/Return-to-Sender Default Delivery Method defined in Application Feature Permissions/Ticket Permissions
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. The application should be loged in.
2. Transaction should be completed for the Ptron A with DHL delivery method.
3. 3 tickets should be selected from ticket services, delivery view and forwarded.
4. 3 tickets should be forwarded to Patron B and the transaction should be completed.Order details should be shown correctly as required and the order should be verified.
5. 2 unforwarded tickets should be printed.
6. The tickets from transaction 1 and delivery one should be recalled.
7. A new delivery should be created using the Recall/Return-to-Sender Default Delivery Method defined in Application Feature Permissions/Ticket Permissions for the 3 tickets on which recall action was performed.

1. Login to PV with valid credentials
Expected Result:
user should login successfully
2. Navigate to Patron Management and Create a patron
Expected Result:
Prerequisite should met
3. Navigate to Market Permissions tab
Expected Result:
market permission tab should selected 
successfully
4. Add and Agency.
5. 1. Select the Agency added above.
2. In the 'ACQUIRE SETTINGS' panel, Verify that 'Allow' checkbox is enabled if inherit checkbox is unchecked
Expected Result:
Allow checkbox should be enabled if inherit checkbox is unchecked for acquire patron market permissions

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Login to PV with valid credentials
2. Navigate to Patron Management and Create a patron
3. Navigate to Market Permissions tab
4. Add and Agency.
5. 1. Select the Agency added above.
2. In the 'ACQUIRE SETTINGS' panel, Verify that 'Allow' checkbox is enabled if inherit checkbox is unchecked
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. user should login successfully
2. Prerequisite should met
3. market permission tab should selected 
successfully
4. 
5. Allow checkbox should be enabled if inherit checkbox is unchecked for acquire patron market permissions

title: Perform anonymous sales transaction with credit card and verify the Card response fields
custom_steps:
1. 1. Input * in the Search Field
2. Click Find Button
3. click on the Sell icon in the Search Results Grid
Expected Result:
The Selected Event should be listed in the My Events list and should be available for the Sale
2. 1. Input no. of seats in the offer page
2. Select Default buyer Type
3, Click Best Available Seat
Expected Result:
Patron cart should be displayed with Seat Details
3. 1. Click on the delivery tab.
2.Select a delivery method from the drop down.
3. Populate the address from the file
4.Click Apply button.
Expected Result:
System should able to allow the user to select a delivery method from the drop down and the address field should be populated by selecting an address from the file.
4. 1. Select any credit card from the payment portlet
2. Input Valid card  Number
3. Input Valid PIN number
4. Input the name and required parameters 
4. Click Accept Payment
Expected Result:
Payment should be successful
5. 1. Navigate to Ticket Services
2. Search for the Transaction Id
3. Select the Payments tab
4. Verify the following details are displayed
    1. authorization #
    2. card holder name
    3. address\postal code used for AVS
    4. AVS response
    5. cardholder present status (yes or no)
    6. card swipe status (swiped or not)
    7. cvv response
    8. merchant ID
    9. reference #
    10. Settlement batch ID
Expected Result:
The following details with the correct value should be displayed in the Payments tab
6. Repeat step 1-7 for package transactions
Expected Result:
The card response details should be displayed correctly in the Payments tab under Ticket services
7. Call

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1. Input * in the Search Field
2. Click Find Button
3. click on the Sell icon in the Search Results Grid
2. 1. Input no. of seats in the offer page
2. Select Default buyer Type
3, Click Best Available Seat
3. 1. Click on the delivery tab.
2.Select a delivery method from the drop down.
3. Populate the address from the file
4.Click Apply button.
4. 1. Select any credit card from the payment portlet
2. Input Valid card  Number
3. Input Valid PIN number
4. Input the name and required parameters 
4. Click Accept Payment
5. 1. Navigate to Ticket Services
2. Search for the Transaction Id
3. Select the Payments tab
4. Verify the following details are displayed
    1. authorization #
    2. card holder name
    3. address\postal code used for AVS
    4. AVS response
    5. cardholder present status (yes or no)
    6. card swipe status (swiped or not)
    7. cvv response
    8. merchant ID
    9. reference #
    10. Settlement batch ID
6. Repeat step 1-7 for package transactions
7. Call
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. The Selected Event should be listed in the My Events list and should be available for the Sale
2. Patron cart should be displayed with Seat Details
3. System should able to allow the user to select a delivery method from the drop down and the address field should be populated by selecting an address from the file.
4. Payment should be successful
5. The following details with the correct value should be displayed in the Payments tab
6. The card response details should be displayed correctly in the Payments tab under Ticket services
7.

title: Verify whether Auto-Renewal enabled payment plan the Auto-Renew = Yes value is set on the package in the Claim reservation for Normal package
custom_preconds:
Prerequisite:
Create a package with Auto-Renewal = true
Create a Payment plan with Auto-Renewal = true

Create a patron with default digital wallet item
custom_steps:
1. Login to PV
Expected Result:
	
Login should be successful
2. 	
Navigate to Ticket sales
Select the package and patron
lock seats
Expected Result:
Seat lock should be successful
3. 	
Click on Reserve
Click on Settings link in cart
complete checkout
Expected Result:
Package Order info modal should be displayed with Auto-Renew value as Not-Defined

Checkout should be successful
4. Navigate to Order details page
Select action as Claim reservation
Select all tickets
Expected Result:
Order should be placed to cart
5. 	
Assign delivery
Create receivables for the cart amount using Auto-Renew enabled payment plan

Schedule installments using a default wallet item of the patron

Click on Settings link in cart

Complete checkout
Expected Result:
Delivery should be assigned

Receivables should be created and installments should be set

Package Order info modal should be displayed with Auto-Renew value as YES
Checkout should be completed successfully
6. 	
Navigate to Order details page
Click on Package Order info icon

Verify whether Auto-Renewal enabled payment plan the Auto-Renew = Yes value is set on the package in the claim order for Normal package
Expected Result:
Package Order info modal should be displayed with Auto-Renew value as YES

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Login to PV
2. 	
Navigate to Ticket sales
Select the package and patron
lock seats
3. 	
Click on Reserve
Click on Settings link in cart
complete checkout
4. Navigate to Order details page
Select action as Claim reservation
Select all tickets
5. 	
Assign delivery
Create receivables for the cart amount using Auto-Renew enabled payment plan

Schedule installments using a default wallet item of the patron

Click on Settings link in cart

Complete checkout
6. 	
Navigate to Order details page
Click on Package Order info icon

Verify whether Auto-Renewal enabled payment plan the Auto-Renew = Yes value is set on the package in the claim order for Normal package
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 	
Login should be successful
2. Seat lock should be successful
3. Package Order info modal should be displayed with Auto-Renew value as Not-Defined

Checkout should be successful
4. Order should be placed to cart
5. Delivery should be assigned

Receivables should be created and installments should be set

Package Order info modal should be displayed with Auto-Renew value as YES
Checkout should be completed successfully
6. Package Order info modal should be displayed with Auto-Renew value as YES

package is Auto-Renewal = true, and the order that the package is sold to has a claim reservation with a payment plan that is Auto-Renewal - true,
custom_steps:
